titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Joseph Coy Green Papers, 1914-1957
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Diary, correspondence, writings, reports, pamphlets, clippings, maps, and printed matter, relating to the Commission for Relief in Belgium, American Relief Administration activities in Romania and Transcaucasia, and the Herbert Hoover-for-President campaign in 1920.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Joseph Coy Green Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

chronitem.event: Born, Cincinnati, Ohio
A.B., Princeton
A.M., Princeton
Graduate studies, University of Grenoble and University of Paris
Instructor, History, Bordentown Military Institute
Instructor, History, Columbia University
Chief of Inspection for Belgium and Occupied Areas of France, Commission for Relief in Belgium
Director for Romania and later the Near East, American Relief Administration
Chairman, Ohio Committee for the election of Herbert Hoover.
Assistant Professor of History, Princeton
Associate Professor of History, Princeton
Assistant, Division of Western European Affairs, State Department
Chairman, Committee to Revise Foreign Service Examinations
Chief, Office of Arms and Munitions Control
Chief, Division of Controls
Executive Secretary, National Munitions Control Board
Special Assistant to the Secretary of State
Advisor on Arms and Munitions Controls
Chairman, Advisory Committee on Foreign Service Examinations
Ambassador to Jordan
died

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

odd.p: Reports, memoranda, and printed material relating primarily to Joseph C. Green's association with the Commission for Relief in Belgium, the American Relief Administration, and the Ohio State Committee for Herbert Hoover in the presidential compaign of 1920. Materials are arranged alphabetically by title or subject.

scopecontent.p: Manuscripts of brief articles by Joseph C. Green containing his impressions of his experiences in Belgium.
Typewritten selections from the Joseph C. Green diaries.
European maps, aerial photographs, bank notes, paper coins.

did.unittitle: Green, Mrs. and Mrs. James A., 1914-1918
Green, Mrs. and Mrs. James A., 1919-1929
American Hospital of Paris, Annual Reports, 1917, 1918, 1919
Comite National de Secours et d'Alimentation (National Committee for Relief and Food)
Rapport - Juillet, Aout et Septembre, 1915 (Report - July, August, and September, 1915)
Ministere de l'Interieur - Annuaire Statistique 1913 (Ministry of the Interior - Statistical Yearbook, 1913)
Ministry of Justice and Ministry of Foreign Affairs - "War of 1914-1916"
"Clothing the Destitute of Belgium and the North of France"
Digest of Opinions of the Judge Advocate General of the Army, 1918 (incomplete)
Avis, Proclamations and Nouvelles de Guerre, Les (Opinions, Proclamations and News of the War), Historical souvenir booklets
"Etudes et Documents sur la Guerre" (Studies and Documents on the War), 3 pamphlets, 1915
American Institute of Mining Engineers. Hoover's Inauguration Address, February 17, 1920
Cincinnati Post - letters to the editor
"With the A.R.A. in Roumania" by Robert Green
Department of State - International Traffic in Arms, 1935-1942 (booklets)
Hearings on Exportation of Arms or Munitions of War, 1933
National Munitions Act (contains statement by Joseph C. Green)
National Munitions Control Board, Annual Reports, 1936-1940
Belgium. Manuscripts of articles by Joseph C. Green containing his impressions of his experiences in Belgium.
Typewritten selections from Joseph C. Green diaries
